result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph C. Gleason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph C. Gleason

records.addlTxt: Remedial Contempt Order

Joseph C. Gleason does not appear in court. Nancy L. Bergstrom appears for Lincoln County. Cases are called. County is heard. Default judgment is entered by the Court, a lump sum payment in the amount of $600 is ordered; payment plan in the amount of $150/mo beginning on December 2, 2019 and every month thereafter by the 1st untl balance is paid in full; 30 days jail STAYED for failure to comply with lump sum payment and/or payment plan. Jail as sanction does not satisfy balance. Full balance will be due if taken into custody.
Notice and Order to Show Cause
Motion for Contempt and to Impose Sanctions

Defendant Joseph C. Gleason in court, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant would like to proceed without counsel - Off record for defendant to read revocation order and warrant additional pages - On record - Defendant takes issues with a couple of factual issues - Statements by defendant regarding factual issues - Arguments by DA Bayne-Allison to sentencing - Arguments by Gleason to sentencing - Defendant asking if time is going to run concurrent - 
14CF302 - Court sentences defendant to 1 year jail with huber each count concurrent - Credit for 174 days served
14CF109 - Court sentences defendant to 1 year jail with huber with Credit for 281 days served - Defendant does not understand
Cases and charges to run concurrent - Civil judgment for unpaid court obligations - Post conviction rights given
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 29, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph C. Gleason in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements regarding plea agreement - Statements by Dunphy/Koppelman/Court to sentencing
13CF293 OWI 3rd - 60 days jail with huber  to 14CF109 - 24 months d/l - 24 months IID - Assessment -  $600 plus costs (No probation)
14CF109 OWI 4th - 182 days jail with huber consecutive- 26 month d/l revocation consecutive -26 months IID  consecutive-  Assessment - $600 plus costs
14CF302 Possession of THC - CC/Surcharges only - 2 days credit if revoked
Possess Amphetamine - CC/Surcharges only
5 years probation each count concurrent - AODA and follow through with recommended treatment- Counseling as recommended by Agent - Blood draw fee
Voting rights/Firearm restriction
Sentencing hearing at 05-03-2016 02:30 pm

The court puts the plea questionaire on the record by reading the form.    Not to own or possess any firearms.  DNA sample unless already done.

All bonds in the cases remain in force until sentencing.  Sentencing will be at a later date so deft can get in for the AODA assessment and treatment so will be able to get huber while in jail.

All three cases called and appearances given.  Deft enters a plea of no contest to Count 5 in 13CF293, Count 1 is dismissed outright, Counts 2-4 - DRI; plea of no contest to Counts 1&3 in 14CF302, Counts 2, 4-7- DRI; plea of no contest to the amended charge in 14CF109 Count 2 and Count 1 - DRI.   Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Defendant Joseph C. Gleason in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF302 - 14CF109 - Court recites agreement as on SNP - Statements by parties - Bond continued  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-11-2016 02:30 pm
